attributes.action: Expand sanctions to all entities supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
attributes.additional_details:
Ukraine is a sovereign and democratic state whose freedom is now
threatened by a Russian invasion. The UK has a proud history of
defending democracy and protecting states from repression and
authoritarian rule. The UK is a signatory to the Budapest memorandum, in which it pledged to uphold the sovereignty of Ukraine. Foreign Minister Liz Truss has said the UK stands "shoulder to shoulder with Ukraine". Now is the time to take further measures to fulfil the UK's pledge to protect democracy.
attributes.background:
Block all transactions and trade by UK companies with Russian
companies in the metallurgy and energy sectors. Implement all measures to freeze the assets of all Russians banks in the UK. Extend UK sanctions to cover all individuals and entities on the US and EU list of sanctions.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced additional sanctions on Russia. You can read the Government's statement on these sanctions here: https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2022-02-28/debates/3D28CB2C-B2E4-40B4-B40A-6D0D1147B6C9/Sanctions

And you can find details of the UK’s sanctions regime relating to Russia here: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-sanctions-on-russia

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Place the strictest possible sanctions on Russia until it withdraws from Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609428

Seize assets held by anyone with close ties to the Russian government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609418

Full embargo of Russian imports in lieu of active military support in Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609457
